Spain: Hisham was overthrown and imprisoned by his cousin Muhammad II of Córdoba.
Sulayman ibn al-Hakam, at the head of an army of disaffected Berbers and with the help of García of the Good Laws, defeated Muhammad, forcing the latter to flee to Toledo, Spain, and freed Hisham.
Vietnam: The imperial court acclaimed Lý Thái Tổ emperor of Đại Cồ Việt.
